SALOME
Nazimova Productions, 1923.  Directed by Charles Bryant.  Camera:  Charles Van Enger. Production designer Natacha Rambova based on the illustrations by Aubrey Beardsley

Salome was produced by and starred the flamboyant Russian actress, Alla Nazimova. Her intention was to produce a piece of work that would raise the artistic levels of American movies. Filmed in 1923, it might be considered one of the first Ã¢â‚¬Ëœart-houseÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ films to be made.

* THIS NEW SOUNDTRACK:

The music of Charles Koechlin is featured almost throughout, with its post-impressionistic, mystical atmospheres, its daring and colourful orchestrations and an overall sensation of early XXth cent. avant-gardism.
